content: time through so that you can make your other mc sections match repeat between ** once more work 23-round chart one more time knit 35 rounds with mc or if you adjusted for gauge differences match to previous mc sections counting the 10 rounds cowl began with finishing break the mc yarn leaving a 48 / 122 cm tail unpick waste yarn from the cast-on sts and place the live sts on spare circular needle with rs facing out bring the beginning and end pattern notes together and graft sts together invisibly using kitchener stitch this cowl is knit in the round throughout beginning with a weave in all ends provisional cast-on upon completion the beginning is grafted to the end to create a seamless snug and cozy double-layer block cowl to measurements cowl the colorwork is done by stranding your two colors along according to the pattern chart included on the next page in our samples we treated the cc as our pattern color and held it in our left hand to come up from underneath the mc held in our right hand optional if you tend to work colorwork tightly you may wish to go up a needle size for each charted motif section begin cowl with waste yarn crochet hook and gauge needle provisionally cast on 90 sts we used a crochet provisional cast on make a slip knot with your waste yarn and put it on the crochet hook form an x with the hook pointing to the left resting on top of the needle pointing to the right yarn over and pull through the loop on the hook catching the needle and creating a stitch on the needle repeat until 90 sts are cast on break waste yarn and fasten off
